name: Other applicant not applied for a final order
body:
Dear ((first name)) ((last name)),

Your ((partner)) has still not applied for a final order. They have to apply before your ((isDivorce??marriage))((isDissolution??civil partnership)) can be legally ended. This is because you are doing a joint application. 

#What you can do 
 The quickest way to ((isDivorce??finalise your divorce))((isDissolution??end your civil partnership)) is for your ((partner)) to apply for the final order. They have been emailed details of how to do this. You should contact them to remind them, if it's safe to do so. 

If you do not think they will apply then you can apply for a final order as a sole applicant. This will mean your ((partner)) becomes the respondent. You can apply for a final order as a sole applicant by signing into your HMCTS account: ((signin url)) 

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email
subject: Your ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership))
